DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine safety efficacy Kovacaine Mist ( 3 % tetracaine HCl 0.05 % oxymetazoline HCl ) anesthesia maxillary teeth dental procedure .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Effectiveness Kovacaine Nasal Spray Dental Anesthesia
DOC.detailed_description: The primary objective single-center , randomize , double-blind , active-controlled , parallel-group study determine Kovacaine Mist provide anesthesia maxillary teeth sufficient performance dental procedure . Secondary objective include determination whether Kovacaine Mist provide anesthesia soft tissue evaluate safety tolerability Kovacaine Mist sham injection compare sham nasal spray 2 % lidocaine hydrochloride 1:100,000 epinephrine submucosal injection determine change vital sign report side effect adverse event .
DOC.criteria: Male female 18 65 year age Sufficiently healthy determine investigator receive test control medication undergo schedule dental procedure Required operative restorative procedure single maxillary tooth , maxillary second third molar , treatment time expect exceed 60 minute Could breathe nostril Had normal lip , nose , eyelid , cheek sensation Could understand sign inform consent document Could communicate investigator Could understand comply requirement protocol Clinically relevant history presence respiratory , gastrointestinal , renal , hepatic , hematological , lymphatic , cardiovascular , psychiatric , musculoskeletal , neurologic , genitourinary , infective , inflammatory , immunological , dermatological , connective tissue disease disorder clinically relevant history presence angleclosure glaucoma Clinically relevant sinus/nasal surgical history Baseline Visual Analog Scale value > 36 ( great weak ) treatment site Had dental work require local anesthetic within last 24 hour take pain medication within last 48 hour Required prophylactic antibiotic subacute bacterial endocarditis ( infectious endocarditis ) Allergic intolerant tetracaine , benzocaine , ester local anesthetic , paminobenzoic acid ( PABA ) , find PABAcontaining sunscreen Allergic intolerant oxymetazoline , epinephrine , preservative solution Had current condition , nasal congestion sinus infection , may influence response study medication History alcoholism and/or drug abuse Had take monamine oxidase inhibitor within past 3 week Were nursing , pregnant , suspected pregnant , try become pregnant ( female require take urine pregnancy test rule pregnancy ) Had use investigational drug and/or participate clinical trial within 30 day baseline
